title: Learning Hokkinese/ Southern Min through Poems and Songs
description: An elementary course designed for students who are interested in language and culture in Taiwan and Southern Fujian. Course content includes sounds and tones, simple daily conversation, traditional and popular songs, as well as ancient and modern poetry. Classroom activities include 1. Comparing and analysing the differences in pronunciation, vocabulary and grammar of Hokkinese/ Southern Min, Cantonese and Putonghua; 2. Song appreciation; 3. Poetry appreciation and recitation. This course will also help learners understand Taiwan and Southern Min culture, and understand Putonghua with a Hokkinese/ Southern Min accent better.
outcome: Upon completion of this course, students will be able to:1. Converse on simple daily topics;2. Understand the differences between Hokkinese/ Southern Min, Cantonese and Putonghua in terms of consonants, vowels, tones, vocabulary and grammar;3. Recite selected ancient and modern poems in Hokkinese/ Southern Min;4. Recite the lyrics of selected modern songs in Hokkinese/ Southern Min;5. Understand Putonghua with a Hokkinese/ Southern Min accent better.完成本科目後，學生將能夠：1. 掌握簡單的日常會話；2. 了解福建話、廣東話和普通話在聲母、韻母、聲調、詞彙和語法方面的差異；3. 用福建話朗誦十餘首古代與現代詩；4. 用福建話朗誦十餘首現代歌曲的歌詞；5. 更好地聽懂帶有福建話口音的普通話。
